items.prompt: B1. Which of the following number is divisible by 3?

B2. Harry does his paper round in Long Street. He has to deliver one newspaper to each house with an odd number. The first house with an odd number is 15 and the final house has the number 53. How many houses does Harry have to visit?
B3. The product of four different natural numbers is 100. What is the sum of the four numbers?
B4. 2009 people are taking part in a public fun run. The number of people Hans beat is three times as big as the number that finished before him. In which place did Hans finish the race?
B5. A function f(x) satisfies f(2)=4 and its tangent at x=2 passes through (0,0). What is f′(2)?
B6. A long number is built by writing the number 2009, 2009 times in a line. How big is the sum of all odd numbers within this number that are immediately to the left of an even number?

B7. Leonhard made up a sequence where, starting with the third term, each term is the sum of the previous two numbers. The fourth number is 6 and the sixth number is 15. What is the seventh number in the sequence?
B8. If f(x)=3x²+2x+1 and g(x)=f(−x), what is g′(2)?
B9. Maria can achieve 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5 points in a test. After 4 tests she has a mean of exactly 4. One of the following sentences can therefore not be true. Which one is it?

B10. On the island of the nobles and liars 25 people are standing in a queue. The first person in the line claims that everybody behind him is a liar. Each of the other people claims that the person in front of him is a liar. How many liars are actually in the queue? (Nobles tell the truth and liars always lie.)
B11. The area under y=x² from x=0 to x=a equals the area of a rectangle of height 2 and width a/2. Find a.
B12. If a ⋄ b = ab + a + b and 3 ⋄ 5 = 2 ⋄ x, then x equals
B13. The difference of n and 10 is less than 10. How many whole numbers n are there with this characteristic?

B14. Friday writes different positive whole numbers that are all less than 11 next to each other in the sand. Robinson Crusoe notices that adjacent numbers are always divisible by each other. What is the maximum amount of numbers he could have written?
B15. A 6-foot-tall person walks away from a 15-foot-tall streetlight at 2 ft/s. How fast is the tip of their shadow moving when the shadow is 8 ft long?
B16. How many 10-digit numbers exist that are solely made up of the numbers 1, 2 and 3 (not necessarily all of them) and where adjacent numbers always differ by exactly 1?
B17. All factors of a number N (except 1 and N itself) are written down one after the other. The biggest factor is 45 times the smallest. For how many numbers N is that true?
B18. For the curve y = x^3, the tangent line is parallel to y = 12x + 1 at two distinct points. What is the sum of the x-coordinates of those tangency points?

B19. Robert wants to place stones on a 4×4 gameboard so that the number of stones in each row and each column is different, giving 8 different amounts. He may put any number in a cell or leave cells empty. What is the minimum number of stones needed?
B20. A number of oranges, peaches, apples and bananas are put in a row. What is the minimum number of fruits needed so that each fruit lies next to each other fruit at least once?
B21. A differentiable function h(x) has h′(x)>0 for x<3 and h′(x)<0 for x>3. Which statement must be true?
choices: A) h(x) has a local minimum at x=3
B) h(x) has a local maximum at x=3

items.prompt: B22. How many 0s have to replace the star * in the decimal number 1.*1 to obtain a number that is smaller than 2009/2008 but bigger than 20009/20008?
B23. Three corners of a die (not all on one face) have the coordinates P(3, 4, 1), Q(5, 2, 9), and R(1, 6, 5). What are the coordinates of the midpoint of the die?

B24. A single-digit prime number is called “strange”. A prime with more than one digit is “strange” if the numbers obtained by deleting the first digit and deleting the last digit are both strange again. How many strange primes are there?
B25. For some differentiable function f(x), it is known that f′(x)=0 ⇔ f(x)=c, a constant. Which of the following must be true?
B26. For how many positive whole numbers a do a² and a³ have the same amount of digits?

B27. Sylvia has several fair 12-sided dice, each with the numbers 1 to 12 on its faces. If she rolls all the dice simultaneously, the probability of rolling exactly one 12 is equal to the probability of not rolling a 12 at all. How many dice does Sylvia have?
B28. 20 points are distributed equally along a circle. How many of the segments connecting two of those points are longer than the radius of the circle but shorter than the diameter of the circle?
B29. A function f: ℝ → ℝ satisfies f(20 − x) = f(22 + x) for all real x. It is known that f has exactly two real zeros. What is the sum of the two zeros?
B30. A special four-digit number abcd satisfies the equation abcd = a^a + b^b + c^c + d^d. What is the value of a?
